I used to be a Costco fan. Now, not so much. My favorite vitamins (Smarty Pants for women) were discontinued, although they still carry the children's vitamins. My store in Humble, Texas has stopped carrying Kirkland's decaffeinated coffee AGAIN so I have to drive 45 minutes to get it at The Woodlands store, so I stock up. On one recent visit, the shelves in a few areas had so many empty boxes, I had to move them to get to the product. It's just not the same.

Kelly, we know how disappointing it can be to not find your family staples in stock. We've gone ahead and let our buyers know of your product suggestions for your area. Please know that you can leave your feedback directly to our buyers for your local warehouse using the 'Feedback Tab' here: https://www.costco.com/WarehouseFeedback.html Thanks for letting us know. -Kim

My wife and I have raised three babies on Kirkland Formula and diapers. Ive also kept them in glasses for a 10th of the price of buying them at the optometrists. If you are not raising your kids on Costco, you are paying too much for basics.

I want to express my support for your commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. DEI fosters a stronger, more inclusive workplace and benefits both employees and customers. Please do not be influenced by political pressure to abandon these important values. Many of us appreciate and support companies that prioritize fairness and opportunity for all.

Assuming it's a formula thing they've been rolling out over the last few months. Likely you'll have good muffins until they run out of ingredients. I've had the muffins on the right at my Costco in Tucson AZ for 2-3 months. They pale in comparison. The deal is 8 normal sized muffins for $7 instead of 12 giant muffins for $10. If you're lucky, you'll just get to keep good muffins and maybe even be able to resell them to people like myself going through a good muffin famine.
..we got the ones on the right and loved them HOWEVER, we only got to try poppy seed muffins and cinnamon muffins.

The only options at my Costco are blueberry and the cinnamon ones. I've tried the blueberry ones. My analysis is that they are more dry and the blueberries tasted kinda weird. The cinnamon ones look like they are a dumbed down version of the seasonal pumpkin muffins. I'm just bummed as a consumer that the deal is very blatantly a worse deal, and they don't taste as good. Also no chocolate options.
Understandable. I got disappointed in ours when they started only putting blueberries on the top of the muffin.
